page.title: 13Bwlchgwyn Village
page.content: Bwlchgwyn is a village about five and a half miles to the west of Wrexham.It is in the hills above the town.The hills form a large semi-circle around the main town below. Bwlchgwyn is at the northern end of this semi-circle, on the edge of moorland. The village itself is built on sandstone with coal measure outcrops to the east.The rocks around the village are highly mineralised and within the sandstone may be found lead ore, mined in years gone by. Silica,fireclay,iron-ore,coal and limestone have also been quarried around the area.Sandstone is still quarried at a nearby location. The name of Bwlchgwyn literally means "White Gap" or "White Pass",and is normally thought to refer to the white colour of the rocks above the village.
